newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: DIRBTINIS PLUOSHTAS WILL NOT PAY DIVIDENDS.
newsitem.headline: DIRBTINIS PLUOSHTAS WILL NOT PAY DIVIDENDS.

text.p: Lithuania's artificial fibre producer Dirbtinis Pluoshtas said on Tuesday that it will keep its 1996 profits within the company.

"The general shareholders' meeting decided on Friday not to pay dividends and to use the 1996 profit to upgrade production lines," Benjamina Jakavichiene, the advisor to the company's general director, told Reuters by telephone.
The company earlier reported that its net profit in 1996 was 4.08 million litas versus 3.5 million litas the previous year.
"The company is in need of around 20 million litas to upgrade its spinning equipment in 1997," Jakavichiene added.
Jakavichiene also said that the Securities comission had registered a fresh injection of share capital, bringing the company's share capital to 96 million litas from 48 million litas.
The company used its own reserves for the share capital increase.
Dirbtinis Pluoshtas exports 80.5 percent of its products.
The state runs 16 percent of the company and the rest is owned by private investors.
Dirbtinis Pluoshtas is listed on the Vilnius bourse's A group.
